intro: Pavonia cancellata var. crassivenosa, commonly known as the broadleaf pavonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple bracts that surround its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in warm climates.
